results.name: In binary representation of n: delete one zero in each contiguous block of zeros.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: a(n) = b(n, 0), where b(n, r) = if n = 1 then 1 else b(floor(n/2), 1 - n mod 2)*(1 + floor((1 + r + n mod 2)/2)) + n mod 2.
For n <= 1, a(n) = n, and for n > 1, if n is odd, then a(n) = 1+2*a((n-1)/2), otherwise, when n is even, a(n) = (2^(A007814(n)-1)) * a(A000265(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, May 13 2018
program: a106151 = foldr (\b v -> 2 * v + b) 0 . concatMap
(\bs'@(b:bs) -> if b == 0 then bs else bs') . group . a030308_row
(PARI) A106151(n) = if(n<=1, n, if(n%2, 1+(2*A106151((n-1)/2)), A106151(n>>valuation(n, 2))<<(valuation(n, 2)-1))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, May 13 2018
